perturbation.original_text: The Customizations shall fulfill or exceed all of the functional, performance and other specifications described in the Program Materials and the documents prepared either by Bank of America or Supplier pursuant to this Agreement. as indicated below.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customizations should endeavor to fulfill the functional, performance and other specifications described in the Program Materials and documents prepared by either Bank of America or Supplier pursuant to this Agreement, as reasonably practical.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a definite obligation to 'fulfill or exceed' specifications. The modified text weakens this by using 'should endeavor to fulfill' and 'as reasonably practical,' making the obligation less strict and more subjective. This introduces ambiguity as to what constitutes 'reasonable' effort and whether failing to fully meet specifications constitutes a breach of contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Laws - General Contract Law Principles

perturbation.original_text: No later than <<enter Customization Documents Delivery Date>>, Supplier shall deliver to Bank of America the documents described below for this Customization. The detailed specifications so delivered shall be incorporated herein when approved by Bank of America.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier will aim to deliver the documents to Bank of America. The integration of delivered detailed specifications will be subject to review by Bank of America.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'shall deliver', creating a clear obligation with a specific deadline. This has been changed to 'will aim to deliver', creating uncertainty around whether those documents will be delivered by that time. In addition, the new text mentions 'will be subject to review' when the previous text said 'shall be incorporated herein' introducing more ambiguity. This introduces ambiguity as to what will be reviewed. Bank of America can now claim that the documents do not meet their standards, delaying the fulfillment of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Laws - General Contract Law Principles

perturbation.original_text: If the proposed price Is Increased by Supplier upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America may terminate this Schedule and shall receive a refund of all amounts previously paid hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: If the proposed price Is Increased by Supplier upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America retains the option to terminate this Schedule, and a refund of amounts previously paid hereunder will be considered.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Bank of America 'shall receive a refund' which is a clear obligation. The revised text indicates that a refund 'will be considered', making the refund discretionary rather than guaranteed. This introduces ambiguity regarding whether a refund will actually be provided upon termination, creating the possibility of a dispute.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Laws - General Contract Law Principles
